Sparkly Ginger Margarita Recipe | Bon Appétit




Skip to main contentOpen Navigation MenuMenuStory SavedTo revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved stories.Close AlertCloseStory SavedTo revisit this article, select My Account, then View saved storiesClose AlertCloseSign InSearchRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastMerch ShopsponsoredSparkly Ginger MargaritaHilary Cadigan’s Sparkly Ginger Margarita packs a one-two ginger punch with ginger syrup *and* powdered ginger. Top it with seltzer for a bit of fizz this February. Produced in partnership with Patrón Tequila.By Hilary CadiganFebruary 22, 20214.0(7)Read ReviewsTriangleEmailPinterestPrintPhoto by Chelsie CraigEmailPinterestPrintEmailPinterestPrintIngredientsCocktail:1½oz. Patrón Silver Tequila1½oz. fresh-squeezed lime juice2dashes of orange bitters¾oz. ginger syrup*Splash of soda (to taste)Garnish:2tsp. sugar1tsp. salt1tsp. powdered ginger1lime wedge (can use a leftover piece after squeezing for juice)1sprig fresh rosemaryPreparationStep 1Mix sugar, salt, and powdered ginger together and pour in an even layer onto a flat surface. Wet rim of glass with lime wedge then dip glass into powdered mixture to coat rim.Step 2Combine 1½ oz. of Patrón Silver Tequila, lime juice, ginger syrup, and bitters in a shaker with ice. Shake for 30 seconds or until exterior of shaker is too frosty to hold.Step 3Pour cocktail into glass and top with soda and rosemary sprig.Step 4Enjoy!* Ginger syrup should be easy to find at most grocery stores (and some liquor stores) but you can also make your own out of 1 cup sugar, 1 cup peeled and sliced ginger, ¾ cup water. Mix together, bring to a boil, simmer 15 minutes, steep for an hour and voila!How would you rate Sparkly Ginger Margarita?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTriangleWish I had seen this sooner!
